title: The Glories of Srila Narottama Dasa Thakura | Sri Jai Chaitanya Dasa | Sri Gaura Mandala Parikrama
speaker: HG Jai Chaitanya Dasa

segments.key_quote: And he built the first temple, his family, rich family, they built the first temple.
segments.summary: This segment describes the birthplace of Narottama Das Thakur, the establishment of the first temple, its subsequent destruction in 1971, and the efforts to rebuild it.
This segment recounts Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's prediction of Narottama Das Thakur's birth and the anticipation among the devotees, culminating in his auspicious birth.

themes: Refusal to eat without offering to Vishnu
segments.key_quote: This baby will grow up to be the greatest of men.
segments.summary: This segment details Narottama Das Thakur's birth, the astrological predictions surrounding him, his refusal to eat until food is offered to Lord Vishnu, and the subsequent emphasis on the importance of Prasad.

segments.key_quote: O Padmavati, take my love and keep it here. When Narottama comes and bathes here, give it to him.
segments.summary: This segment describes Mahaprabhu's prema (love) for Narottama, his request to the Padmavati river to safeguard it, and Narottama's eventual reception of this prema after bathing in the river.

segments.key_quote: Narottama Das Thakur wished to inaugurate his six deities on the auspicious occasion of Gaurapurnima at his hometown in Keturi.
segments.summary: This segment recounts Narottama Das Thakur's journey to Vrindavan, his desire to inaugurate six deities, and the grand festival he organized at Keturi for this purpose, including the arrangements and the prominent Vaishnava attendees.

segments.key_quote: In 1971, everything was done. The people here took over this place, destroyed everything.
segments.summary: This segment briefly mentions the destruction that occurred in 1971, the loss of the deities, and the retrieval of some Shaligrams.
